translation.en: [boy snarling] No! No!
translation.ja: やめろ！

translation.en: [woman] I'm your mother.
translation.ja: ママよ

translation.en: -[woman speaking indistinctly] -[boy yelling] Don't do that! -[woman speaking indistinctly] -[boy laughs evilly]
translation.ja: 音声と写真はすべて本物です

translation.en: [man 1] What we have here is a confrontation between good and evil,
translation.ja: この町で起こったのは 善人と悪魔の戦いだった

translation.en: and the place that evil picked was Connecticut.
translation.ja: 悪魔が選んだのは コネチカット州

translation.en: My name is David Glatzel.
translation.ja: 俺はデヴィッド

translation.en: When I was 11, I was possessed by the devil.
translation.ja: 11歳の時 俺は悪魔に憑依(ひょうい)された

translation.en: A bizarre murder trial gets underway tomorrow in Danbury, Connecticut.
translation.ja: 奇妙な殺人事件の 裁判が始まります

translation.en: The crux of this case is a claim of demonic possession.
translation.ja: 事件の焦点は “悪魔の憑依”です

translation.en: That's what an attorney for a Connecticut teenager will try to prove.
translation.ja: 弁護士は悪魔の存在を 証明するつもりです

translation.en: [man 2] I said, "Why am I here?"
translation.ja: 〝ブルックフィールド 警察〞 〝僕はなぜここに？〞 〝ブルックフィールド 警察〞

translation.en: And he said, "Well, you just killed your friend."
translation.ja: 〝ブルックフィールド 警察〞 〝友人を 殺したからだ〞と 〝友人を 殺したからだ〞と

translation.en: [newscaster 1] A man who was arrested last month in Connecticut for murder says that he will plead innocent
translation.ja: 殺人容疑で逮捕された 男は無罪を主張

translation.en: because he was possessed by the devil at the time he committed the crime.
translation.ja: 悪魔が取り憑(つ)いて やったと供述しています

translation.en: Are you kidding?
translation.ja: 冗談だろ？

translation.en: There was drinking. There was a stabbing.
translation.ja: 酒を飲んで刺したんだ

translation.en: This is an open-shut case. This is ridiculous.
translation.ja: よくある事件さ ばかばかしい

translation.en: [newscaster 2] The tale really begins in the house at the end of this driveway,
translation.ja: 物語の始まりは この道沿いの家に住む

translation.en: where the Brookfield couple whose 11-year-old son began acting strangely.
translation.ja: 11歳の少年による 奇妙な行動からでした

translation.en: -[possessed David growling] -[woman] Get up!
translation.ja: 起きて！

translation.en: [David] I don't like to be remembered as the 11-year-old boy that was possessed…
translation.ja: あの憑依された少年と 知られたくない

translation.en: [possessed David] You will die!
translation.ja: お前は死ぬ

translation.en: …but I gotta deal with it every day.
translation.ja: 気をつけてる

translation.en: [young man] You can't hurt God's child.
translation.ja: 神の子よ

translation.en: [possessed David] Jesus is gonna die in hell.
translation.ja: イエスは地獄へ行く

translation.en: I have never spoken to anybody about this.
translation.ja: だから誰にも話してなかった

translation.en: It's a secret, a dark secret.
translation.ja: 秘密だった 暗いね

translation.en: [people praying] Our Father, who art in heaven…
translation.ja: 天にまします…

translation.en: Give us this day our daily bread… -[possessed David breathing] -[people continue praying]
translation.ja: トゥルーホラー: 悪魔が私に殺させた

translation.en: [possessed David] You're gonna die!
translation.ja: お前は死ぬんだ！

translation.en: [people] Amen.
translation.ja: アーメン

translation.en: [David] I would love to tell you my story
translation.ja: 俺が憑依された話と

translation.en: about the possession and the murder
translation.ja: 殺人事件のことを話すよ

translation.en: and Arne Johnson.
translation.ja: アーニーのことも

translation.en: I'd like to make sure my family is portrayed
translation.ja: 俺の家族のことは

translation.en: with the accuracy that it should be.
translation.ja: 正確に伝えてほしい

translation.en: I know some people have fabricated some stories,
translation.ja: 過去に話をねつ造されて デヴィッド･グラツェル 過去に話をねつ造されて

translation.en: and I'm not happy with that, so I'd like to set the record straight.
translation.ja: デヴィッド･グラツェル つらい思いをしたから 真実を知ってほしい つらい思いをしたから 真実を知ってほしい

translation.en: [David] When I was 11 years old, I was quiet.
translation.ja: 11歳の頃は 大人しい子だった

translation.en: Life was good.
translation.ja: 幸せだった

translation.en: Playing with my brothers, best time of my life.
translation.ja: 兄たちとよく遊んでた 人生最高の時だ

translation.en: [man] I was the middle child of the boys.
translation.ja: 俺は兄弟の真ん中として―

translation.en: Typical middle-child syndrome.
translation.ja: デヴィッドの兄 アラン･グラツェル 典型的な性格だった

translation.en: I have an older brother, Carl.
translation.ja: 兄のカールは

translation.en: He… [sighs] …was not the easiest brother to go along with.
translation.ja: 気難しくて あまり仲よくなかった

translation.en: He was kind of like an idiot at times.
translation.ja: 愚かな行動をしたりして―

translation.en: Made life difficult.
translation.ja: 迷惑かけてた

translation.en: Alan, back in the day, was just different.
translation.ja: デヴィッドの長兄 カール･グラツェル アランは変わった 子どもだった

translation.en: David and I would help my father and work in the garage and stuff.
translation.ja: デヴィッドと俺は 父を手伝ったが

translation.en: And Alan really didn't want to get dirty, so he stayed with my mother most of the time.
translation.ja: アランは汚れるのが嫌いで 母親にくっついてた

translation.en: You know, he could bake a good cake. I can tell you that much.
translation.ja: 彼はケーキ作りが得意で

translation.en: But, uh, he's just a little different than us.
translation.ja: 俺たちとは違ってた

translation.en: [David] Back then, I wouldn't call us an all-American family,
translation.ja: あの頃は典型的だとは 言えなくとも―

translation.en: but I would say we were as normal as we can be.
translation.ja: 普通の家族だった

translation.en: It all started when my sister, Debbie, found a house in Newtown.
translation.ja: 姉のデビーが新しい家を 見つけたのが始まりだった

translation.en: She was going to move in with her boyfriend, Arne.
translation.ja: 恋人のアーニーと住むためさ

translation.en: Debbie and I were very excited to move in together.
translation.ja: デビーと住めるのが うれしかった デビーの恋人 アーニー･ジョンソン デビーと住めるのが うれしかった

translation.en: We had plans on being married in the spring.
translation.ja: デビーの恋人 アーニー･ジョンソン 春に結婚する予定で その準備だった

translation.en: We were working towards that.
translation.ja: 春に結婚する予定で その準備だった

translation.en: We couldn't wait. We couldn't wait.
translation.ja: 楽しみにしてた

translation.en: July 2nd, Debbie found a really nice house in Newtown to rent.
translation.ja: ７月２日 デビーがいい物件を見つけた

translation.en: [David] I was a little sad to see them move out.
translation.ja: 俺はさみしかった

translation.en: You're 11 years old, it's your sister.
translation.ja: 姉が家を出ていくのが

translation.en: Me and my older brothers, Alan and Carl, ended up going there to help them move in.
translation.ja: 俺とアランとカール 家族みんなで 引っ越しを手伝いに行った

translation.en: It was a weird house.
translation.ja: 奇妙な家だった

translation.en: There was just something really off about it.
translation.ja: どこか気味が悪かった

translation.en: [Debbie] I assigned each of my brothers a chore.
translation.ja: 弟たちに仕事を与えた

translation.en: I sent David into the master bedroom,
translation.ja: デヴィッドの姉 デビー･グラツェル デヴィッドには主寝室の

translation.en: and handed him a broom and asked him if he could sweep up for me.
translation.ja: デヴィッドの姉 デビー･グラツェル 掃き掃除をお願いしたわ 掃き掃除をお願いしたわ ２００５年の インタビュー 掃き掃除をお願いしたわ

translation.en: I left him in there alone.
translation.ja: 彼を１人残して―

translation.en: And then I started doing what I had to do, scouring and cleaning.
translation.ja: 私は他の部屋の 片づけをしていたの

translation.en: But after a while, David came running out.
translation.ja: 突然 デヴィッドは 外へ走りだした

translation.en: He looked upset, and I didn't know why.
translation.ja: 何かに動揺していた

translation.en: [Alan] David said, "Mom, I wanna go home."
translation.ja: デヴィッドは “家に帰りたい”と

translation.en: She's like, "I can't leave. We'll get this done."
translation.ja: “掃除が終わってから”と 母が言っても

translation.en: "As soon as we can, we'll go home." He's like, "I wanna go home now."
translation.ja: “掃除が終わってから”と 母が言っても 彼は嫌がった

translation.en: I just wanted to get out of the house,
translation.ja: すぐ離れたかった

translation.en: off the property, away from it as far as I could.
translation.ja: あの家から一刻も早く

translation.en: And I… I didn't tell anybody the reason why.
translation.ja: 理由は誰にも言わなかった

translation.en: We got back home, had dinner, everything was fine.
translation.ja: 帰宅後 夕食までは普通だった

translation.en: My mom was an excellent cook.
translation.ja: 母は料理上手だった グラツェル家の ホームビデオ

translation.en: She was Hungarian and Italian,
translation.ja: 彼女はハンガリー系と グラツェル家の ホームビデオ 彼女はハンガリー系と イタリア系で 料理は得意だった

translation.en: so she knew how to cook.
translation.ja: イタリア系で 料理は得意だった

translation.en: But David was having a bad day. Something was bothering him.
translation.ja: その日のデヴィッドは 機嫌が悪かった

translation.en: And I said, "What's wrong with you?"
translation.ja: 理由を聞いた

translation.en: [David] I remember sitting at the table.
translation.ja: 夕食の時に―

translation.en: Started explaining what had happened that morning.
translation.ja: 朝の出来事を家族に話した

translation.en: I was in the bedroom on my own.
translation.ja: １人で寝室にいた

translation.en: But I could feel something.
translation.ja: 何かを感じた

translation.en: And then I was pushed backwards onto the bed.
translation.ja: ベッドに押し倒された

translation.en: [David] I seen this image.
translation.ja: そして見た

translation.en: It looked like the devil from a Halloween costume.
translation.ja: ハロウィンの悪魔のように

translation.en: His eyes were black, solid black, just like a chunk of coal,
translation.ja: そいつの目は石炭の 塊みたいに真っ黒だった

translation.en: and it scared me.
translation.ja: 恐ろしかった

translation.en: David said, "Then this entity spoke."
translation.ja: デヴィッドは “そいつが言ったんだ”と

translation.en: [Debbie] I said to David, "What is this figure telling you?"
translation.ja: “何を言われたの？”と 私が聞くと

translation.en: "He keeps telling me beware."
translation.ja: “気をつけろ”と 言われたって

translation.en: I said, "Beware of what?"
translation.ja: “何に？”と聞くと

translation.en: And he kept telling me, "He wants my soul."
translation.ja: 悪魔は“お前の魂が欲しい”

translation.en: And he said, "He's gonna come for me. That's what he keeps telling me."
translation.ja: “だから迎えに行く”と 言ったらしい

translation.en: "I-- You gotta help me."
translation.ja: 彼は恐れてた

translation.en: I said, "Dave, did you touch anything in the medicine cabinet?"
translation.ja: デヴィッドに“薬でも 飲んだか？”と聞くと

translation.en: He goes, "No, this is for real."
translation.ja: “本当だよ”って言うんだ

translation.en: We didn't believe him at first.
translation.ja: 最初は誰も信じなかった

translation.en: [Alan] My mom's reaction was,
translation.ja: 母の反応も 夜遅かったから

translation.en: "It was late at night. Maybe he was dreaming."
translation.ja: 母の反応も 夜遅かったから 夢だろうと

translation.en: [Arne] Judy said, "Okay, enough of this."
translation.ja: 彼らの母親ジュディは “もう遅いから寝なさい”

translation.en: "It's time to go to bed, get some rest, and we'll revisit this in the morning."
translation.ja: 彼らの母親ジュディは “もう遅いから寝なさい” “話は明日”と言った

translation.en: [David] Later that night, I got sort of a weird feeling.
translation.ja: その夜中に 奇妙な気分になった

translation.en: I just had this image.
translation.ja: イメージが浮かんだ

translation.en: There was something coming.
translation.ja: 何かが近づく

translation.en: I started to get scared
translation.ja: 怖かった

translation.en: 'cause I could see it coming closer towards the house.
translation.ja: 何かが家に 近づいてる気配がした

translation.en: You can feel something watching you.
translation.ja: 視線を感じたんだ

translation.en: I thought I saw a figure.
translation.ja: 何かを見た気がした

translation.en: [David] When I look again…
translation.ja: 外を見ると―

translation.en: there's nothing there.
translation.ja: 何もいなかった

translation.en: I stayed up in the dark with my eyes open most of the night.
translation.ja: 暗闇の中 一晩中 目を開けていた

translation.en: [Arne] Judy was worried about David,
translation.ja: ジュディは不安になり―

translation.en: so she called Father Dennis up to let him know what was happening.
translation.ja: デニス神父に電話して 何があったかを伝えた

translation.en: She asked him if he could come bless the house.
translation.ja: そして家を清めてほしいと

translation.en: [Judy] Bless you too, Father.
translation.ja: どうも 神父

translation.en: My mom was religious.
translation.ja: 母は信心深かった

translation.en: She made us go through Communion and Confirmation as Catholics.
translation.ja: 俺らもカトリック教会の 聖餐(せいさん)式や堅信礼を受けた

translation.en: We did believe in God and the devil.
translation.ja: だから神と悪魔を信じていた

translation.en: When Father Dennis had come to the house, he brought some holy oil, some holy water,
translation.ja: デニス神父は聖なる油と 聖水を持って家にやってきた

translation.en: and some incense…
translation.ja: お香も

translation.en: [Father Dennis] In the name of the Father…
translation.ja: 父の御名によって…

translation.en: [David] …that he used to bless the entire house, every room, upstairs and downstairs.
translation.ja: それらを使って家中の すべての部屋を清め回った

translation.en: We thought it was over and done with.
translation.ja: 解決したと思った

translation.en: [Father Dennis] I pray against any evil that…
translation.ja: すべての悪から守り…

translation.en: But this was just the beginning.
translation.ja: だが始まりに過ぎなかった

translation.en: [Debbie gasps] Oh my God!
translation.ja: 何？

translation.en: [Alan] It was three o'clock in the morning.
translation.ja: 夜中の３時だった

translation.en: All of a sudden, David was screaming at the top of his lungs,
translation.ja: デヴィッドが絶叫して

translation.en: "He's coming for me. He's coming for me. He's gonna punish me."
translation.ja: “僕はお仕置きされる”って

translation.en: The house rumbled…
translation.ja: 家が揺れた

translation.en: …like someone had drove a truck into it.
translation.ja: 車が突っ込んだみたいに

translation.en: It sounded like a UFO was landing on top of the house.
translation.ja: ＵＦＯが屋根に 着陸したような音だ

translation.en: Whatever it was, it wanted you to know it was there.
translation.ja: 何かが自分の存在を 知らせてた

translation.en: Lights began to flash on and off.
translation.ja: 明かりが点滅した

translation.en: You'd hear the glass falling, breaking.
translation.ja: ガラスが落ちて割れる音

translation.en: David was frantic, and he was screaming, "He's here. He's here. He's over the house."
translation.ja: デヴィッドは大声で叫んだ “やつが来た”って

translation.en: David's like, "Don't open the door. It's evil."
translation.ja: “ドアを開けるな” “悪魔だ”

translation.en: The banging went on for 30, maybe 40 seconds…
translation.ja: ドアを叩く音は 30秒ほど続いた

translation.en: …and then everything went quiet.
translation.ja: そして静かになった

translation.en: -[glass shatters] -[Debbie] Oh my God.
translation.ja: 何てこと

translation.en: I was petrified.
translation.ja: 怖かった

translation.en: Okay, we have a ghost problem,
translation.ja: 家に悪霊がいる

translation.en: um, and we didn't know what to do with it.
translation.ja: だが どうすればいいんだ？

translation.en: We knew we had to find some help.
translation.ja: 助けが必要だった

translation.en: [Alan] At that time, our next-door neighbor,
translation.ja: 当時 隣に住んでたのが

translation.en: she was into tarot card reading and stuff like that.
translation.ja: タロットなどの占い師だった

translation.en: And she said, "You know, my mother-in-law said
translation.ja: 彼女の義母が 霊能者を知ってるから

translation.en: she had gone, a couple of years ago, to see a psychic investigator."
translation.ja: 彼女の義母が 霊能者を知ってるから 相談できるかもしれないと

translation.en: "Maybe they can help."
translation.ja: 相談できるかもしれないと

translation.en: Debbie is like, "I'll take help from anyone."
translation.ja: デビーはすぐ飛びついた

translation.en: We weren't gonna let no entity,
translation.ja: 何者だろうと たとえ悪霊でも

translation.en: no… no ghost or anybody run us out of that house.
translation.ja: 何者だろうと たとえ悪霊でも あの家から 私たちを追い出せない

translation.en: That was our house,
translation.ja: 私の家よ

translation.en: and we were gonna make sure that whatever was there,
translation.ja: だから何がいるのかを 見つけ出し―

translation.en: we were gonna get it out one way or the other.
translation.ja: 解決しようと思った

translation.en: Our special guests tonight, who in their 32 years as ghost hunters,
translation.ja: 今夜のゲストは ゴーストハンター歴32年

translation.en: have investigated over 3,000 cases of haunted houses and demonic possession
translation.ja: 幽霊屋敷や悪魔の憑依事件を 3000件以上を調査し

translation.en: and have been involved in numerous exorcisms around the world.
translation.ja: 世界中の悪霊退治に 関わってきました

translation.en: Listen closely and make up your own mind as we present to you,
translation.ja: 信じるか信じないかは あなた次第です

translation.en: ladies and gentlemen, the ghost hunters Ed and Lorraine Warren.
translation.ja: 心霊研究家の ウォーレン夫妻です

translation.en: [man] I was so proud of my grandparents when I was growing up.
translation.ja: 祖父母のことを 誇りに思ってた

translation.en: [man] I would see them in the newspaper or on television,
translation.ja: 彼らを新聞やテレビで見ると

translation.en: and it was just so cool.
translation.ja: うれしかった

translation.en: But on the other hand,
translation.ja: その一方で

translation.en: I was also the weird kid because I had these creepy grandparents.
translation.ja: 僕は変わった 子どもだった ウォーレン夫妻の孫 クリス･マッキンネル 僕は変わった 子どもだった ウォーレン夫妻の孫 クリス･マッキンネル ウォーレン夫妻の孫 クリス･マッキンネル 奇妙な祖父母が いるせいで

translation.en: [Ed] The truth of the matter is, I did not wake up one day and say,
translation.ja: ある日突然 心霊研究家になろうと

translation.en: "I want to be a demonologist."
translation.ja: 思ったわけではない

translation.en: I was born a demonologist.
translation.ja: それが宿命だったんだ

translation.en: As a boy, I would ask the nuns and the priest, uh,
translation.ja: 幼い時 修道女や 司祭にたずねた

translation.en: "What is this about ghosts, the supernatural? Is it for real?"
translation.ja: 幽霊や超常現象は 本当に存在し

translation.en: "Are there really devils?"
translation.ja: 悪魔はいるのか

translation.en: And, of course, you know, Catholicism teaches us that these things are real.
translation.ja: カトリック教では 本当だと教える

translation.en: My grandmother had a different, uh, experience.
translation.ja: 祖母は違う経験をしていた

translation.en: -I hear laughter and I don't-- -[Ed] Laughter?
translation.ja: 笑い声が聞こえる 笑い声？

translation.en: -I don't quite understand. I can hear it-- -Is it male or a female laughter?
translation.ja: 聞こえるでしょ？ 男？　女？

translation.en: I mean, I can't understand why all of you don't hear it.
translation.ja: みんなには聞こえないの？

translation.en: I hear it so… It-- It's so loud in here.
translation.ja: こんなによく聞こえるのに

translation.en: He said, "Well, if you wanna hunt tigers, you got to go to where tigers are."
translation.ja: 彼女はトラを狩るなら トラの住処に行けと

translation.en: -Go to the light, Charissa. -[shrieking]
translation.ja: 光の方へ向かいなさい

translation.en: I'm here to help you.
translation.ja: 私はあなたの味方よ

translation.en: But they didn't reach any fame until…
translation.ja: だが祖父母が 有名になったきっかけは…

translation.en: A young man murdered, in cold blood,
translation.ja: “１人の若者が家族を殺害”

translation.en: his father, mother, four brothers and sisters,
translation.ja: “両親と兄弟を 殺したきっかけは”

translation.en: because voices told him to do it.
translation.ja: “ある声のせいだった”

translation.en: With that grueling beginning comes a bestseller and a motion picture,
translation.ja: その衝撃的な始まりで 話題の小説が原作です

translation.en: The Amityville Horror.
translation.ja: 「悪魔の棲(す)む家」

translation.en: Lorraine and I have been in hundreds and hundreds of haunted houses,
translation.ja: ロレインと私は 何百もの呪われた家を訪れ

translation.en: and we've interviewed numerous people all over the world.
translation.ja: 世界中の人に取材した

translation.en: And on a scale of one to ten, I would have to say that Amityville was a ten.
translation.ja: その中でもアミティヴィルは もっとも呪われていた

translation.en: The Amityville Horror was the one that went international.
translation.ja: 「悪魔の棲む家」は大ヒットし

translation.en: That's the one where my grandparents became world-famous.
translation.ja: 祖父母は世界的に 有名になった

translation.en: -And, well, it's number two. -[audience applauding]
translation.ja: ２番です

translation.en: It's funny how something so horrifying can end up becoming a blessing.
translation.ja: 恐怖の対象のはずが 脚光を浴びる側になった

translation.en: Thank you, Mr. Warren.
translation.ja: どうも

translation.en: And it… it really did help a lot of families afterward.
translation.ja: 実際 多くの家族が救われた

translation.en: We are receiving a lot of letters
translation.ja: たくさん手紙が届くわ

translation.en: from people who are… are writing in about problems.
translation.ja: みんな悩みを書いて 送ってくるの

translation.en: What's the address?
translation.ja: 住所は？

translation.en: Post office box-- Send it to the Warrens, Ed and Lorraine Warren,
translation.ja: ウォーレン家の 私書箱宛てに送って

translation.en: Post Office Box 41,
translation.ja: 私書箱番号は41

translation.en: Monroe, Connecticut 06468.
translation.ja: コネチカット州 モンローよ

translation.en: [Alan] Debbie called up the Warrens.
translation.ja: デビーは電話した

translation.en: Ed answered. Debbie said who she was and, "Can you help us?"
translation.ja: 電話に出たエドに 助けてほしいと頼んだ

translation.en: Ed said, "Has David been seen by a doctor at this point?"
translation.ja: エドは医者に行ったか聞いた

translation.en: We said, "No." So Ed's like, "Do you mind if I bring a doctor with me?"
translation.ja: まだだったから 彼は医者も連れてくと

translation.en: [Alan] They showed up in a Chevy Chevette.
translation.ja: 車はシボレーだった

translation.en: Ed Warren was a really nice man.
translation.ja: エドはいい人だった

translation.en: He was reassuring, confident.
translation.ja: 彼は自信にあふれていた

translation.en: He definitely made us feel safer.
translation.ja: 我々は安心したよ

translation.en: Lorraine was so gentle and precise in her words.
translation.ja: ロレインはとても優しく 発言が明確だった

translation.en: Judy said, "Oh my God, I'm so glad you're here and so glad to meet you."
translation.ja: ジュディは夫妻が 来てくれたことに感謝してた

translation.en: [Alan] The doctor took David aside, took his blood pressure, stuff like that.
translation.ja: 医者がデヴィッドの体を 診察をした

translation.en: He was tested psychologically, proven to be completely normal.
translation.ja: 精神鑑定の結果 異常はなかった

translation.en: Dr. Tony never said that I was off my rocker or anything like that.
translation.ja: 医者は俺の精神状態に 問題はなく

translation.en: He said I was a… a normal kid.
translation.ja: 正常だと言った

translation.en: [Alan] Ed and Lorraine were very cautious talking to us.
translation.ja: エドとロレインは 慎重に話をした

translation.en: They wanted us to answer some questions, find out what's going on.
translation.ja: 事情を聞くために 俺たちに質問をした

translation.en: [Ed] Okay.
translation.ja: 実際に録音された音声

translation.en: [Ed on tape] David, give me your full name.
translation.ja: 君のフルネームは？

translation.en: -[David] David Michael Glatzel. -[Ed] Okay, how old are you, David?
translation.ja: デヴィッド･グラツェル 年齢は？

translation.en: -[young David] Twelve. -[Ed] Twelve years old.
What do you think about all these things, David?
translation.ja: 何が起こってると思う？

translation.en: -You'd like it to end, right? -[young David] Hmm? -You'd like it to end? -Mm-hmm.
translation.ja: 早く終わらせたいだろう？

translation.en: -You don't want it to go on, do you? -No.
translation.ja: このままでいい？ やだ

translation.en: [Ed] No. Okay.
translation.ja: そうだよな

translation.en: There was one violent scene here that Lorraine told me about.
translation.ja: 恐ろしいことが１回起きた

translation.en: -[Judy] It was more than one. -[Ed] More than one?
translation.ja: １回以上よ

translation.en: [Judy] Oh my God, it was all night!
translation.ja: 一晩中だった

translation.en: [Ed] Okay, so in other words, it was a very hectic night.
translation.ja: とても恐ろしい 夜だったろうね

translation.en: [Judy] Oh yeah, but see, we can't tolerate no more, really.
translation.ja: ええ これ以上は 耐えられない

translation.en: We're not lying to you 'cause, you know, we need the help we can get.
translation.ja: 本当よ　だから助けて

translation.en: Believe me, we wanna get rid of this thing.
translation.ja: 早く終わらせたいの

translation.en: My mom was so hopeful that this would be a cure-all.
translation.ja: 母はとても期待していた これですべてが 解決することを

translation.en: She wanted her family back,
translation.ja: 以前のように

translation.en: and she wanted to go back to the life we had before this.
translation.ja: 家族の生活が 元に戻ると思ってた

translation.en: [Ed] These people are telling us these horrible stories,
translation.ja: 彼らの話を聞くだけでなく

translation.en: but we have to, ourselves, experience this before we accept it.
translation.ja: 信じるためには我々自身も 体験する必要がある

translation.en: -[host] All right. -We have to see it. We have to feel it.
translation.ja: 実際に見て感じなければ

translation.en: We have to know it's there before we say, "Yes, this home is haunted."
translation.ja: その家が呪われてるとは 名言できない

translation.en: [Judy] He told David he wants his soul today.
translation.ja: 魂を取りに来るって

translation.en: [Ed] What'd he tell you about your soul?
translation.ja: 魂について何と？

translation.en: Says he just wants my soul. That was it.
translation.ja: 僕の魂が欲しいって

translation.en: [Ed] Is he here now?
translation.ja: ここにいる？

translation.en: Ed's like, "Let's see it show itself."
translation.ja: エドは“何かするはずだ”

translation.en: "It's got so much power, it needs to prove that it's here."
translation.ja: “悪魔は力を 誇示したがるから”と言った

translation.en: I have to provoke what is there through religious provocation.
translation.ja: 私は宗教的な方法で 挑発するしかない

translation.en: Now being a Christian, I would use the name of Jesus Christ.
translation.ja: イエス･キリストの名や

translation.en: I would use holy water. I would use the crucifix.
translation.ja: 聖水や十字架を使って 挑発する

translation.en: Now, this may seem dramatic,
translation.ja: 大げさに見えるが

translation.en: but this is the method that the exorcist and the demonologist uses.
translation.ja: それが悪魔ばらいや 霊能者のやり方だ

translation.en: I provoke until I can witness physical manifestations occurring.
translation.ja: 何かの現象を 実際に見るまで挑発を続ける

translation.en: [Alan] Ed said, "If you have the power,
translation.ja: エドは“力があるなら”―

translation.en: I need you to knock on the table three times."
translation.ja: “テーブルを３回叩け”と 言った

translation.en: [Arne] All of a sudden…
translation.ja: そして突然…

translation.en: -[loud banging and rumbling] -Bang! Bang! Bang!
translation.ja: バン！　バン！　バン！

translation.en: Sounded like someone took a sledgehammer, trying to break through the kitchen floor.
translation.ja: キッチンの床を 叩き割るような音だ

translation.en: The entire kitchen started to shake.
translation.ja: 部屋全体が揺れた

translation.en: The lights were flickering. Everybody felt it.
translation.ja: 点滅する明かり 全員感じた

translation.en: [Arne] Ed looked at David and he said, "Does this frighten you?"
translation.ja: エドがデヴィッドに言った “怖いか？”

translation.en: David goes, "I'm afraid because he wants to hurt me."
translation.ja: デヴィッドは “傷つけられるのが怖い”

translation.en: "Because I'm talking to you and you're here,
translation.ja: “あなたたちが来たせいで”

translation.en: we're all gonna be punished for this."
translation.ja: “みんな罰を受ける”と

translation.en: At that point, Lorraine was walking around.
translation.ja: ロレインは歩き回ってた

translation.en: Going into a home, I'm there to discern, through vibrations,
translation.ja: 私は その家の波動の 流れを知るために

translation.en: walking throughout every room of the house.
translation.ja: すべての部屋を歩き回る

translation.en: Because there has to be a law of attraction.
translation.ja: 原因を探すためよ

translation.en: The spirit has to be attracted to one member of that particular household.
translation.ja: 霊は家族の誰かに 引き寄せられてるから

translation.en: [Alan] She leaned over to him and whispered,
translation.ja: 彼女はエドにささやいた

translation.en: "There's a large dark mass standing next to that little boy."
translation.ja: “大きくて暗い塊が 少年の横に立ってる”

translation.en: "It's evil."
translation.ja: “悪魔だわ”

translation.en: That felt strange to us. We couldn't see nothing.
translation.ja: 奇妙な感じだった 僕には何も見えなかった

translation.en: Ed and Lorraine spoke to my parents.
translation.ja: エドたちが両親に言った

translation.en: "This is not a ghost. This is a demonic entity."
translation.ja: “これは霊ではなく 悪魔的の存在だ”

translation.en: [David] It really scared me.
translation.ja: 怖かった

translation.en: The whole family was scared 'cause we had no idea what was going on.
translation.ja: 全員がおびえた わけが分からず

translation.en: You know, my grandfather had this idea that hauntings progressed in five steps.
translation.ja: 祖父は呪いのステップは ５段階あると言ってた

translation.en: It starts with permission.
translation.ja: まずは“許可”だ まずは“許可”だ 〝ウイジャ〞

translation.en: Somebody does something
translation.ja: 誰かが何かして

translation.en: that allows the paranormal to take a foothold.
translation.ja: 超常現象を起こす 足がかりを作る

translation.en: Maybe it's an Ouija board or a séance or whatever.
translation.ja: こっくりさんのようなものだ

translation.en: Then you have infestation.
translation.ja: そして寄生され

translation.en: That's where the spirits are in the home, but external to you completely.
translation.ja: 霊が家に入り込むが まだ自身は呪われてない

translation.en: Just a ghost or, you know, a loved one comes to visit and wants to let you know they're there.
translation.ja: ただ自分の存在を 家人に示したいだけだ

translation.en: That's… That's normal.
translation.ja: そこまでは普通だ

translation.en: Then you have oppression.
translation.ja: そして弾圧が始まる

translation.en: That's when an entity is starting to take over your free will.
translation.ja: 入り込んだ霊が体の意思を 乗っ取り始めるんだ

translation.en: But you're exhibiting much darker impulses, much more negative behaviors.
translation.ja: より暗い衝動を感じ ネガティブな行動を起こす

translation.en: In incredibly rare circumstances, it moves on to complete possession.
translation.ja: 非情にまれだが完全に 霊に憑依された状態だ

translation.en: That's where you're no longer there. You're not in control.
translation.ja: 本人の意思はなくなり 制御不能になる

translation.en: Your body has been taken over completely by something else.
translation.ja: 完全に体が乗っ取られてる

translation.en: [Alan] Ed felt strong enough from that first meeting
translation.ja: エドはデヴィッドを一目見て

translation.en: that David was already in oppression stage.
translation.ja: すでに憑依されてると感じた

translation.en: [Arne] Ed explained to us
translation.ja: エドは

translation.en: that the demon would be causing David to act totally different.
translation.ja: 悪魔の影響でデヴィッドの 行動がおかしくなるだろうと

translation.en: Controlling his thoughts, sending messages through him.
translation.ja: 思考や言動が 悪魔に支配され―

translation.en: He would become more volatile.
translation.ja: より乱暴になると言った

translation.en: [Alan] Ed Warren had seen this many times before.
translation.ja: 同じ現象を 何度も見てきたエドは

translation.en: He said, "You're gonna have to contact the church."
translation.ja: 教会に連絡するよう言った

translation.en: My mom said, "We did that. We tried."
translation.ja: もう清めはしたと 母は言ったが

translation.en: And Ed spoke up and said, "No, I will help you do that."
translation.ja: エドは違う方法を教えると

translation.en: "You guys need to start documenting this."
translation.ja: できるだけ記録を残し

translation.en: And collect as much evidence as they can, to present it to the archbishop.
translation.ja: 大司教に多くの証拠を 提出しろと言った

translation.en: And the archbishop of Bridgeport would make the decision
translation.ja: それを見て ブリッジポートの大司教が

translation.en: as far as what we were dealing with.
translation.ja: 判断をするらしい

translation.en: [Arne] I thought, "This stuff isn't real. It doesn't happen."
translation.ja: 正直 信じられなかった

translation.en: "It's only… in cartoons and movies."
translation.ja: こんなのはアニメや 映画の中だけだって

translation.en: Ed and Lorraine warned us how serious this really is.
translation.ja: ウォーレン夫妻は 状況は深刻だと言った

translation.en: "Don't take it lightly."
translation.ja: “油断するな”

translation.en: "Protect yourself,
translation.ja: “自分を守れ”

translation.en: because you never know when it can happen."
translation.ja: “いつ何が起こるか 分からない”

translation.en: [Alan] My mom took our audio tape cassette recorder.
translation.ja: 母にカセット レコーダーを渡した

translation.en: My sister bought a Polaroid camera, you know, that takes instant photos.
translation.ja: さらにポラロイドカメラを 姉が買った

translation.en: From that moment forward, we started keeping records of everything.
translation.ja: 俺たちは記録を 残すようにした

translation.en: We were on summer vacation from school.
translation.ja: 学校は夏休みだった

translation.en: [host on TV] Good evening, ladies and gentlemen…
translation.ja: こんばんは 皆さん…

translation.en: [Alan] No one was sleeping.
translation.ja: 誰も寝ずに

translation.en: [host] …two candidates for the Republican nomination
translation.ja: ２人はアメリカ大統領選の

translation.en: for the presidency of the United States.
translation.ja: 共和党の候補者です

translation.en: Former Governor Ronald Reagan of California. Former ambassador…
translation.ja: ロナルド･レーガン 元カリフォルニア州知事

translation.en: [Alan] We were taking turns keeping an eye on David.
translation.ja: 交代でデヴィッドを 観察していた

translation.en: [Ronald Reagan] Whether we like it or not,
translation.ja: いやが応でも

translation.en: it is our responsibility to preserve world peace
translation.ja: 世界の平和を守るのが 我々の責任です

translation.en: because no one else can do it.
translation.ja: 他の誰でもなく…

translation.en: [in distorted voice] We cannot continue…
translation.ja: このままでは…

translation.en: But then David started acting really weird.
translation.ja: 突然 デヴィッドの 様子が変わった

translation.en: [Judy] David!
translation.ja: デヴィッド！

translation.en: Oh my God.
translation.ja: どうしよう

translation.en: You will die! You!
translation.ja: お前は死ぬ！

translation.en: [Judy] Who are you and what are you?
translation.ja: あなたは誰？

translation.en: -[possessed David] None of your business. -[Judy] David.
translation.ja: お前には関係ない

translation.en: [Judy] Mommy's here. Mommy's here. Come on, get up.
translation.ja: ママよ　起きなさい

translation.en: Come on, let's go. Get out of it. Get out of my son. Get out of my son.
translation.ja: 私の息子の中から出てって

translation.en: [possessed David snarling] No! No!
translation.ja: やめろ！

translation.en: [Judy] I'm your mother.
translation.ja: ママよ

translation.en: You will die!
translation.ja: お前は死ぬ

translation.en: Don't do that! [laughs evilly]
translation.ja: やめなさい

translation.en: [Judy] David, just get up! My God! Get up--
translation.ja: デヴィッド 起きて！ 息子から出てけ

translation.en: [Debbie] Call the priest, Ma.
translation.ja: 神父を呼んで

translation.en: -Have him come to the house right now. -[Judy] Get out of my son!
translation.ja: 息子の体から出てけ！

translation.en: -[possessed David] No! -[young Arne] Leave this boy alone.
translation.ja: この子にかまうな

translation.en: [Debbie] Here. Here.
translation.ja: ほら

translation.en: [young Arne] I'm trying. I got your arms again.
translation.ja: 腕は押さえてる

translation.en: -[possessed David] You fucking cocksucker. -[young Arne] Start saying prayers.
translation.ja: このクソ野郎め 祈りましょう

translation.en: [all] Our Father, who art in heaven, hallowed be thy name. Thy kingdom come,
translation.ja: 天にまします我らの父よ 御名(みな)があがめられますように

translation.en: thy will be done, on earth as it is in heaven.
translation.ja: 御国(みくに)を来たらせたまえ

translation.en: Give us this day our daily bread. And forgive us our trespasses,
translation.ja: 御心(みこころ)の天になるごとく 地にもなさせたまえ

translation.en: as we forgive those who trespass against us…
translation.ja: 我らの日用の糧を…

translation.en: [Alan] It was terrifying…
translation.ja: 怖かった

translation.en: [young Arne] Leave this boy.
translation.ja: 出てって

translation.en: …because all of a sudden, he'll start screaming and fighting,
translation.ja: デヴィッドは突然 叫んで暴れた

translation.en: and there's no one there.
translation.ja: 誰もいないのに

translation.en: [Alan] At one point, we were able to capture on film his hands in midair holding something,
translation.ja: 彼の手が空中で何かを つかんでる様子を撮影した

translation.en: choking him, and he was squeezing with all his might to get these hands
translation.ja: 自分の首をしめる 手のようなものを必死に

translation.en: from around his throat off of his throat.
translation.ja: 引き離そうとしてた

translation.en: [young Arne] Leave this boy. Leave this boy.
translation.ja: この子にかまわないで

translation.en: We had the chills up and down our spine.
translation.ja: 全身鳥肌がたったよ

translation.en: [Arne] It was very frightening, and we didn't really know how to handle it.
translation.ja: あまりにも恐ろしくて 対処しようがなかった

translation.en: [David] I remember being choked, but I don't remember anything else when I blacked out
translation.ja: 首を絞められたこと以外 その時の記憶はない

translation.en: or if I even blacked out or what happened.
translation.ja: 意識を失っていたのかも

translation.en: Nobody could ever answer that.
translation.ja: 正直分からない

translation.en: It was mentally draining for everyone,
translation.ja: 誰もが精神的に消耗してた

translation.en: but it just kept getting progressively worse.
translation.ja: 状況はさらに悪化した

translation.en: He was physically violent with everyone. [Alan] He's tried choking my mother, my sister.
translation.ja: デヴィッドが暴力的になり 母や姉の首を絞めようとした

translation.en: It would last for a few minutes or a few hours.
translation.ja: それが数時間続くことも

translation.en: [Alan] We would take turns sleeping in shifts.
translation.ja: 交代で眠るようにした

translation.en: [Alan] We didn't want to be isolated.
translation.ja: １人になるのを恐れた

translation.en: We know that if we were alone, our chances of an attack were exponential.
translation.ja: １人だと標的になる 可能性が高まるからだ

translation.en: The whole family was getting physically attacked.
translation.ja: 家族全員が攻撃された

translation.en: We were saying prayers constantly.
translation.ja: ずっと祈ってたわ

translation.en: We figured if we said the prayers louder and louder, it would go away.
translation.ja: 大きな声で祈れば いなくなると思ってた

translation.en: [Alan] The most difficult part for my mom was the fact
translation.ja: 母を苦しめたのは

translation.en: that my dad wasn't standing behind her on this.
translation.ja: 父が支えになって くれなかったことだ

translation.en: She felt alone.
translation.ja: 孤独だった

translation.en: My father, at this point, thought David was just having a mental health issue,
translation.ja: 父はデヴィッドは 精神的な病気だと思ってた

translation.en: thought we were feeding into it.
translation.ja: 俺たちのせいで

translation.en: So he kind of just locked himself away.
translation.ja: 彼は家族から逃げ出した

translation.en: He was working two jobs and come home and sleep.
translation.ja: ２つの仕事をして 家には帰ってきて寝るだけ

translation.en: Things changed. We went from having a normal family dinner to him working constantly, not being home.
translation.ja: 以前は一緒だった夕飯の時も 帰っては来なかった

translation.en: It took my dad a while before he realized what was going on.
translation.ja: 父は理解するのに 時間が必要だった

translation.en: And by then, you know, it was too late.
translation.ja: だが気づいた頃は― もう手遅れだった

translation.en: My mom called up the Warrens and told them what was going on.
translation.ja: 母はウォーレン夫妻に 電話で事情を話した

translation.en: [Judy] I'm your mother.
translation.ja: ママよ

translation.en: -[Judy speaking indistinctly] -[possessed David] Don't do that!
translation.ja: やめろ！

translation.en: -[Judy] He didn't know who was doing it. -[Ed] Does he blink his eyes?
translation.ja: 記憶がないの まばたきは？

translation.en: [Judy] No, nothing. They absolutely just stay perfectly still.
translation.ja: しなかった １点を見て動かなかった

translation.en: [Ed] If he was conscious, his eyes would blink, right?
translation.ja: 意識があれば まばたきするだろう

translation.en: [Judy] You mean he was unconscious when he did this, when this happened?
translation.ja: つまり息子は 意識がなかったと？

translation.en: Well, I would think so, yeah. Okay.
translation.ja: そうだと思う

translation.en: Ed and Lorraine told us that David was under possession.
translation.ja: デヴィッドは取り憑かれてる

translation.en: [Chris] After possession,
translation.ja: その目的は

translation.en: the ultimate goal is the destruction of the family and, finally, death.
translation.ja: 家族を破壊し 最終的に 死に至らしめること

translation.en: You're being killed, or… where somebody else is murdered,
translation.ja: 自分が殺されるか― 誰かが殺されるか

translation.en: it does happen.
translation.ja: 何かが起こる

translation.en: [Judy] He went behind Alan, he pulled this out, and he goes, "I hate everybody."
translation.ja: 彼はこれを取りだして “みんな 嫌いだ”

translation.en: "And if anybody goes near me, I'll kill you. Anybody."
translation.ja: “近づいたら殺す”って 言ったわ

translation.en: My mom panicked right then and there.
translation.ja: 母はパニックになった

translation.en: She thought something was gonna happen where her son would kill himself
translation.ja: 息子が自分自身を 殺すんじゃないか―

translation.en: or commit murder.
translation.ja: 殺人を犯すかもと

translation.en: She was like, "We need to stop this now."
translation.ja: 早く解決したがった

translation.en: You know, everything could've been done differently.
translation.ja: 違う方法もあったはずだ

translation.en: There was one incident one evening
translation.ja: こんなことがあった

translation.en: that my mother was screaming at David to stop it, and stop it and calm down, sit down.
translation.ja: 母はデヴィッドに “落ちついて”と叫んでた

translation.en: And he started calling her everything under the sun.
translation.ja: 弟は様々な悪態をついた

translation.en: [possessed David] You fat frigging fucking bitch. [Carl] And all of a sudden, my father came out.
translation.ja: 突然 ２人に 父が近づいていった

translation.en: -[David] You don't deserve to live! -[Judy] David--
translation.ja: 生きる価値がない

translation.en: Get up!
translation.ja: 立て！

translation.en: You hear "slap."
translation.ja: 彼を叩いた

translation.en: [David's father] Get over there and sit down.
translation.ja: そこに座れ

translation.en: [Carl] He goes, "Now I said to stop."
translation.ja: 彼は“もうたくさんだ”

translation.en: [David's father] Enough! No more. It's got to stop.
translation.ja: いい加減にしろ！

translation.en: And sure enough, the, uh, devil sat down and was very quiet.
translation.ja: そして案の定 “悪魔”は とても静かになった

translation.en: So I'm glad at least he listens to my father.
translation.ja: 父には逆らえなかった

translation.en: Okay, one second. Okay, give me one…
translation.ja: ちょっと待て　いいぞ

translation.en: [Carl] The night of the murder, my dad and I were working outside
translation.ja: 殺害が起きた夜 俺と父は外にいて

translation.en: and my mother screamed,
translation.ja: 母がやってきた

translation.en: [Carl] "We have to get to the kennel. Something happened. Debbie's hysterical."
translation.ja: デビーの周りで 何かが起きたと叫んだ

translation.en: -We have to go. -All right.
translation.ja: 急いで

translation.en: [Carl] We get there, and Debbie's like, "Oh, there was a bad fight."
translation.ja: 到着するとデビーが “ケンカが起きて”

translation.en: "Alan got stabbed. He's over there."
translation.ja: “アランが刺された”と

translation.en: I saw Alan laying on his side. That's when I went over to him and rolled him over.
translation.ja: 倒れてる アランのもとに行った

translation.en: Keep in mind, I'm 15 or…
translation.ja: 俺は15才だった

translation.en: I don't know what to do. I never had to deal with this in my life.
translation.ja: どうすればいいか 分かるわけない

translation.en: And I remember seeing the four stab wounds. Um, it was four.
translation.ja: 刺し傷が４か所 あったのを覚えてる

translation.en: He was gasping for air. I just kept telling him, "Alan, hold on."
translation.ja: 苦しむ彼に“がんばれ”と 言い続けた

translation.en: So, you know, what are you gonna do?
translation.ja: 自分だったら どうする？

translation.en: It's like you're, you know, you're… you're stuck.
translation.ja: 何もできないまま 時間だけが過ぎていく

translation.en: You know what I'm saying? It's just, uh…
translation.ja: 分かるだろう？

translation.en: It's not a feeling I like to-- You know, I don't even talk about it, to be honest.
translation.ja: 正直 このことを 話すのも苦痛だ

translation.en: It's something I don't want to remember, because it was just something--
translation.ja: 思い出したくないんだ 俺は何もできなかった

translation.en: You can't help somebody. You know, it's like… there was nothing I could do.
translation.ja: 俺は何もできなかった 何もね

translation.en: It's just sad to see somebody die like that.
translation.ja: 死ぬのを見るのはつらい

translation.en: The murder of Alan Bono,
translation.ja: アランの死に

translation.en: I never even thought it was connected to David.
translation.ja: デヴィッドのことは関係ない

translation.en: There's nothing demonic in this.
translation.ja: 悪魔なんていなかった

translation.en: Arne was very possessive of Debbie.
translation.ja: アー二ーは独占欲が強かった

translation.en: There was speculations and rumors that Debbie was having an affair with Alan Bono.
translation.ja: デビーがアランと 浮気してるという噂(うわさ)があった

translation.en: [Glenn] I remember Debbie Glatzel came to the police department,
translation.ja: デビーが警察にやってきた

translation.en: and she said, "You know, I'm hearing rumor
translation.ja: 彼女は噂を聞いたと

translation.en: that this murder was o-over a three-way,
translation.ja: この殺人事件が起きた原因が 彼女とアラン

translation.en: a triangle between myself and Alan Bono, uh, with Arne Cheyenne Johnson."
translation.ja: アーニーの三角関係の もつれにとるものだという

translation.en: And she says, "It wasn't." She says, "I had a relationship with Alan Bono."
translation.ja: 彼女は“アランとは 付き合ってたけど”

translation.en: "That's over with, and this… this stabbing, this murder had nothing to do with that."
translation.ja: “２人の関係は終わっていて 事件とは関係ない”と言った

translation.en: A bizarre murder trial gets underway tomorrow in Danbury, Connecticut.
translation.ja: 奇妙な殺人事件の裁判は明日

translation.en: The crux of this case is a claim of demonic possession.
translation.ja: 事件の焦点は “悪魔の憑依”です

translation.en: Jim Van Sickle reports.
translation.ja: ジムの報告です

translation.en: [Jim] Will the devil be present in this ancient courthouse in Danbury, Connecticut tomorrow?
translation.ja: 明日 この古い裁判所に 悪魔は姿を現し―

translation.en: Might he take the stand at some point?
translation.ja: 証言台に立つのでしょうか？

translation.en: [Carl] I did not know that the trial was beginning.
translation.ja: 裁判が始まることを 知らなかった

translation.en: And on the first day of the trial, my parents actually gave me money
translation.ja: 裁判初日 両親から 小遣いをもらった

translation.en: just so I can basically skip school and go do what I want to do for the day.
translation.ja: その日は学校をさぼって １日好きに過ごせって

translation.en: They were petrified of me getting involved in the story,
translation.ja: 彼らは俺がこの件に 関わることを恐れてた

translation.en: because I knew…
translation.ja: 知ってたから

translation.en: this is all fabricated.
translation.ja: すべて虚言だと

translation.en: [Alan] We, as a family, thought Arne would be found innocent
translation.ja: アーニーは 無罪になると信じてた

translation.en: because we were going to have the priest
translation.ja: 除霊を見た神父や ウォーレン夫妻もいるし

translation.en: and the Warrens and all the evidence we gathered,
translation.ja: 除霊を見た神父や ウォーレン夫妻もいるし 録音した音声や 写真などの証拠もある

translation.en: the audio recordings, the photographs,
translation.ja: 録音した音声や 写真などの証拠もある

translation.en: and be able to show the court Arne did not commit murder,
translation.ja: それらがアーニーは 無実だと証明してくれる

translation.en: um, he was possessed 'cause he challenged the beast.
translation.ja: 悪魔に憑依された証拠になる

translation.en: The prosecution was pushing for a maximum sentence for a guilty conviction.
translation.ja: 検察側は彼は有罪であり 最高刑を求刑していた

translation.en: This is a case which, uh, the media has
translation.ja: この事件はマスコミや

translation.en: and the Warrens have, uh, spent a good deal of time publicizing,
translation.ja: ウォーレン夫妻の思惑で 世間に広められた

translation.en: uh, for their own, I would suspect, financial interest.
translation.ja: 彼らの利益のために

translation.en: But as far as I am concerned, this is a, uh, routine,
translation.ja: だが この事件は 私の知る限り

translation.en: to the extent it's possible to have a routine homicide.
translation.ja: 極めて日常的な殺人事件だ

translation.en: To come out and say this was just a bunch of baloney,
translation.ja: すべてはただの 虚言だと言い放った

translation.en: that we were trying to cover up just a simple murder case.
translation.ja: 周囲がアーニーの殺人を ごまかすための茶番だと

translation.en: If Arne had been convicted of murder, he was facing 25 to life.
translation.ja: 殺人で有罪なら懲役は 25年から終身刑だった

translation.en: -[suspenseful music playing] -[cameras clicking]
translation.ja: 〝保安局〞

translation.en: Getting inside the courthouse was extremely difficult.
translation.ja: 裁判は傍聴者が多すぎて

translation.en: It was standing room only.
translation.ja: 立ち見だった

translation.en: Nobody knew what exactly to expect.
translation.ja: 誰も予想ができない

translation.en: It was almost like a… a showdown was going to occur
translation.ja: 対決が始まろうとしていた

translation.en: with Martin Minnella coming in with this demonic possession defense,
translation.ja: ミネラ弁護士は 悪魔の存在を主張し

translation.en: and Judge Robert Callahan having to make a ruling on whether he was going to admit it or not.
translation.ja: 判事がそれを認めるか否か 世間が注目した

translation.en: It was a reality check, to be honest with you.
translation.ja: 現実だとは思えなかった

translation.en: Here I was, in court. Never been there before. Facing 25 to life.
translation.ja: 人生で初めての裁判で 終身刑になるかもしれない

translation.en: And it was, uh, surreal. Mmm.
translation.ja: 非現実的だった

translation.en: [Martin] I believed that my client was going to get his day in court.
translation.ja: アーニーが法廷で 発言する機会があると思った

translation.en: Let the jury evaluate the credibility of what occurred.
translation.ja: 起きたことの信憑(しんぴょう)性を 陪審員に評価してもらう

translation.en: Not just believe in faith,
translation.ja: 思い込みではなく

translation.en: believe in actual physical evidence and testimony,
translation.ja: 物的証拠や証言を 聞いてほしかった

translation.en: and then make their mind up based on this.
translation.ja: それに基づいて 判断するべきだ

translation.en: But it never got that far.
translation.ja: だが行われなかった

translation.en: The judge listened to precedence, to arguments, and then he said
translation.ja: 判事は過去の 判例などに基づき

translation.en: that demonic possession is not an acceptable defense.
translation.ja: 悪魔の憑依を 認めませんでした

translation.en: It is irrelevant in this case and in courts in the United States. It is not a science,
translation.ja: 非科学的なことは この国の司法では認めず

translation.en: and he will permit no evidence on demonic possession and devils.
translation.ja: 証拠にも能力がないと 判断しました

translation.en: Jim Van Sickle, News 4, Danbury.
translation.ja: ダンベリーからジムでした

translation.en: I was devastated.
translation.ja: ショックだった

translation.en: And you can hear all the sighs from the family. Like, "Oh my God."
translation.ja: 家族から落胆の ため息が聞こえた

translation.en: In court, you had to put your hand on the Bible and swear on the Bible.
translation.ja: 法廷では 聖書に手を置いて誓う

translation.en: But that's okay. But other than that,
translation.ja: 神は信じるのに

translation.en: they don't believe anything in… in supernatural or… or the devil.
translation.ja: 超常現象や 悪魔は信じないのか

translation.en: So how does that work?
translation.ja: 意味不明だ

translation.en: Right in front of me,
translation.ja: 私の目の前で―

translation.en: the five or six Catholic priests who were there got up in unison,
translation.ja: ５ ６人の神父たちが 同時に立ち上がり出て行った

translation.en: it was almost like it was rehearsed,
translation.ja: 訓練してたように

translation.en: and marched out, never to be heard from again.
translation.ja: 彼らは二度と 現れなかったし

translation.en: And the church didn't comment on this case, uh, going forward.
translation.ja: 教会も何も コメントしなかった

translation.en: [Arne] I felt abandoned.
translation.ja: 見捨てられたと感じた

translation.en: Didn't have the chance to tell the whole truth.
translation.ja: 真実を言う機会もなかった

translation.en: But they would never allow the truth, so… felt lost.
translation.ja: 言っても認めなかっただろう 途方に暮れた

translation.en: Wha-- What do we do now?
translation.ja: この次は？

translation.en: The trial in Danbury resumes tomorrow.
translation.ja: 裁判は明日再開されます

translation.en: It became a very difficult case then for the defense to argue
translation.ja: アーニーを弁護するには 状況はとても厳しかった

translation.en: because you had the signed statements with the police of his sisters,
translation.ja: 警察の報告書には 彼がアランを刺したという

translation.en: who said they saw Arne stab Alan.
translation.ja: 〝アーニーが 刺したのを見た〞 妹らの目撃証言が 記載されてた

translation.en: And if you couldn't say, "Yeah, but he did that
translation.ja: それが悪魔のせいだとは 誰にも分からない

translation.en: because of demonic possession," uh, you're left with, "He stabbed him."
translation.ja: それが悪魔のせいだとは 誰にも分からない 刺した事実だけ

translation.en: Martin Minnella told me that the only thing we can really go for is self-defense.
translation.ja: ミネラ弁護士は 正当防衛を主張すると言った

translation.en: And he goes, "That's the plea we're going to present."
translation.ja: これが残された手段だと

translation.en: Not guilty of murder in the first degree. Manslaughter.
translation.ja: 第一級殺人ではなく過失致死

translation.en: The problem is, self-defense isn't retaliation.
translation.ja: 問題は報復は 正当防衛ではないこと

translation.en: In other words, if somebody came at you,
translation.ja: 誰かに襲われた時に

translation.en: you might stab him once, maybe twice, but not a number of times.
translation.ja: 刺すのは１回か２回まで 複数回はやりすぎだ

translation.en: Because if you do that,
translation.ja: そうなると―

translation.en: self-defense goes out the window.
translation.ja: 過剰防衛とみなされる

translation.en: To suddenly say that it was self-defense,
translation.ja: 突然 正当防衛を主張した

translation.en: when it wasn't put forward as that at the beginning,
translation.ja: 最初と言ってることが 変われば―

translation.en: um, certainly seemed unusual.
translation.ja: 不自然に見える

translation.en: That was the only way that I would have a chance not to get 25 to life.
translation.ja: それが殺人罪での懲役刑を 免れる最後の方法だった

translation.en: I had to take the stand.
translation.ja: 証言台に立った

translation.en: It was kind of difficult to take the stand because I really didn't remember what happened.
translation.ja: 記憶がなかったから 証言するのは難しかった

translation.en: And that's what I told them.
translation.ja: そう証言した

translation.en: I think everybody felt this was just a very unfortunate story on so many different levels.
translation.ja: 不幸な事件だったと 誰もが感じたと思う

translation.en: But at the same time, there was somebody who was dead
translation.ja: だが男が１人死んでおり

translation.en: and somebody who had caused that death, and justice had to be done.
translation.ja: その死を招いた者を 裁く必要がある

translation.en: [David] There was tension in the family.
translation.ja: 家族は不安だった

translation.en: My sister was… was horrified that he was gonna be convicted of murder,
translation.ja: 姉はアーニーが 殺人罪で有罪になり

translation.en: and he'd spend the rest of his life in jail.
translation.ja: 終身刑になることを恐れた

translation.en: I was brought up to the courtroom. The room was filled.
translation.ja: 法廷に連れていかれた 満員だった

translation.en: The judge came, and he got the verdict from the foreman of the jury.
translation.ja: 裁判官が来て 陪審長から評決をもらう

translation.en: I was very nervous and terrified.
translation.ja: 不安で恐ろしかった

translation.en: The verdict was not guilty of murder in the first degree,
translation.ja: 判決は第一級殺人は 無罪だったが

translation.en: guilty of manslaughter in the first degree.
translation.ja: 過失致死で有罪だった

translation.en: Then we came to sentencing.
translation.ja: 量刑が下された

translation.en: I remember Judge Callahan's words to this day.
translation.ja: 今でも判事の言葉を覚えてる

translation.en: "I have no alternative but to give you the maximum sentence allowed."
translation.ja: “被告人に 最高刑を言い渡す”

translation.en: "Ten to 20 years to a maximum-security prison."
translation.ja: “懲役10年から 20年の極刑だ”

translation.en: When I was handed the sentence, Debbie jumped up and told the judge,
translation.ja: 量刑が言い渡されると デビーが判事に向かって

translation.en: "Callahan," she goes, "you're sick. You're insane."
translation.ja: “あなたは正気じゃない”と 叫んだ

translation.en: And then she just went running, crying.
translation.ja: そして外に出て泣きだした

translation.en: When I was exiting the courthouse,
translation.ja: 俺が法廷を出る時

translation.en: Debbie broke through the camera people, ran up to me to give me a kiss.
translation.ja: デビーはマスコミを押しのけ 僕にキスをした デビーはマスコミを押しのけ 僕にキスをした 〝悪魔の恋人〞

translation.en: And I told Debbie, I said, "I want you to go live your life
translation.ja: 彼女に“自分の人生を 生きてくれ”

translation.en: 'cause I don't know what's gonna happen with mine."
translation.ja: “僕を忘れて”と言った

translation.en: "This way you still have a life."
translation.ja: “自由になれ”と

translation.en: She started to cry. She goes, "You don't love me."
translation.ja: “私を愛してないの？”と 聞かれ

translation.en: I said, "I do love you. That's why I'm giving you freedom."
translation.ja: “愛してるからだ”と答えた

translation.en: She goes, "No, I will never leave you."
translation.ja: でも彼女は拒んだ

translation.en: I've always said it from the beginning.
translation.ja: 最初から信じてた

translation.en: Arne's innocent.
translation.ja: 彼は無実よ

translation.en: He's been to hell and back.
translation.ja: 地獄のようだった

translation.en: [Alan] My mom was very upset about it.
translation.ja: 母は怒ってた

translation.en: She knew that he was under demonic possession.
translation.ja: 悪魔のせいだと 信じていたからだ

translation.en: He was a non-violent person.
translation.ja: 彼は温厚だった

translation.en: She felt horrible for Arne.
translation.ja: 母はアーニーを憐れに思った

translation.en: -[dial tone] -My mom wanted the story told.
translation.ja: だから話すことにした

translation.en: She wanted to tell the truth, and wanted people to know what was going on.
translation.ja: 世間に真実を 伝えたかったんだ

translation.en: Seated next to me is a mother of a once-possessed child, and she's here to share with us her story.
translation.ja: 彼女の息子が悪魔に 憑依された体験を聞きます

translation.en: -How do you do? -[host] Nice to have you.
translation.ja: ようこそ

translation.en: Tell me how David is today.
translation.ja: 息子さんの様子は？

translation.en: Well, he's not possessed anymore. He's out of possession.
translation.ja: もう悪魔は除霊されてます

translation.en: Right. Totally normal?
translation.ja: 普通どおり？

translation.en: Totally normal, and, um… [inhales deeply]
translation.ja: ええ でも…

translation.en: Arne still has a lot of problems.
translation.ja: アーニーは違う

translation.en: Here's a young man who is now in prison.
translation.ja: 彼は刑務所に服役中だ

translation.en: He is serving a ten- to 20-year sentence for manslaughter
translation.ja: 過失致死罪となり 懲役は10年から20年

translation.en: for something he really is not responsible for.
translation.ja: 無実にも関わらずね

translation.en: After the trial, my mother ended up going to… Hollywood.
translation.ja: 裁判の後 母が 最終的に向かった先は― ハリウッドだ

translation.en: We all flew on a jet.
translation.ja: 飛行機に乗り―

translation.en: We got picked up in a limo and go on to dinner with Dick Clark.
translation.ja: ディック･クラークと ディナーをした

translation.en: She was enjoying it. She was very excited,
translation.ja: 母は楽しんでた

translation.en: and she couldn't believe this was happening to her.
translation.ja: 生活の変化に興奮していた

translation.en: But Ed and Lorraine Warren had an agenda.
translation.ja: ウォーレン夫妻には 目的があった

translation.en: They said, "You guys will be millionaires."
translation.ja: 金持ちになれると言った

translation.en: The Warrens told me that they were gonna do a book.
translation.ja: 夫妻は本を 出版しようとしてた

translation.en: They already had the author lined up, which I guess he did a previous book for them.
translation.ja: 前作に関わってた作家に 依頼をしていたようだ

translation.en: They brought Mr. Brittle up to talk with us,
translation.ja: その作家に会わせられ―

translation.en: and they asked a… a bunch of questions.
translation.ja: たくさん質問された

translation.en: Ed said, "Make it scary." He goes, "But I checked with the people, and they said this didn't happen."
translation.ja: 彼は事実を書きたがったが エドが“脚色しろ”

translation.en: Ed goes, "Make it scary. People come to us. They buy scary."
translation.ja: “怖がらせた方が 本が売れる”と言った

translation.en: Ed and Lorraine Warren took over.
translation.ja: あとは夫妻が引き継いだ

translation.en: Six months later, the Warrens show up with paperwork,
translation.ja: 半年後 夫妻は 契約書を持ってきた

translation.en: and my mom's like, "Should we get a lawyer?"
translation.ja: 母は弁護士を呼ぼうとしたが

translation.en: And Lorraine's like, "No, dear."
translation.ja: ロレインが引き止めた

translation.en: "William Morris Agency has a whole floor of lawyers."
translation.ja: 事務所には 弁護団がいるからと

translation.en: Yes, they do. But it's not for them. It's for youse.
translation.ja: だが 彼らが守るのは 俺たちじゃない

translation.en: -[Lorraine] Hello. -Hi, Lorraine? Judy.
translation.ja: ロレイン？

translation.en: -Hi, Judy. -[Judy] How you doing?
translation.ja: どうも 元気？

translation.en: [Lorraine] Good, dear.
translation.ja: ええ

translation.en: -[Judy] Did you find out anything yet? -What, honey?
translation.ja: 何か進展は？

translation.en: -[Judy] About the book or anything? -[Lorraine] Everything is great.
translation.ja: 本のことで 順調よ

translation.en: [Judy] Okay, good.
translation.ja: よかった

translation.en: Because youse put so much work into this. We went through all the tragedy.
translation.ja: 忙しそうだけど 被害にあったのは私たちよ

translation.en: And I'll tell you, we need the money just like you do.
translation.ja: 私たちもお金が必要なの

translation.en: [Carl] My mother and father received $4,500,
translation.ja: 両親は4500ドルを 手にしたが―

translation.en: but Ed and Lorraine Warren received $81,000 and some change.
translation.ja: ウォーレン夫妻は ８万1000ドル以上稼いだ

translation.en: They're still making money on it with the Conjuring films.
translation.ja: 今でも 「死霊館」で稼いでる 〝全米を震撼させた 悪魔事件〞 今でも 「死霊館」で稼いでる

translation.en: [David] Lorraine told me I was gonna be a rich little boy
translation.ja: 〝「死霊館 悪魔のせいなら無罪」〞 本の契約すれば 金持ちになれると言った 本の契約すれば 金持ちになれると言った

translation.en: from having this book deal.
translation.ja: 本の契約すれば 金持ちになれると言った

translation.en: And that was a lie.
translation.ja: ウソだった

translation.en: The Warrens made a lot of money off of us.
translation.ja: 俺たちは利用されたんだ

translation.en: If they can profit off you, they will.
translation.ja: 自分たちが大金を得るために

translation.en: They're not gonna pass up that deal.
translation.ja: 彼らは狡猾(こうかつ)だった

translation.en: [Carl] When my mother realized that she was getting, as she calls it, hoodwinked,
translation.ja: 母は夫妻に だまれてたことに気づいた

translation.en: she lost faith in them.
translation.ja: 失望してた

translation.en: They were good at what they did, and they knew how to talk to people and knew how to play people.
translation.ja: 夫妻は周りを懐柔し だますことに長けてた

translation.en: They were very good con people.
translation.ja: 詐欺師と同じさ

translation.en: [Alan] My brother David felt guilty over the whole ordeal.
translation.ja: 弟は罪悪感を覚えてた

translation.en: [sighs] Heartbroken, actually, 'cause he knew that Arne was innocent.
translation.ja: アーニーが無実だと 信じていたから余計に

translation.en: I could've never made it through this time without Debbie's support.
translation.ja: デビーのおかげで 乗り越えられた

translation.en: The support gave me hope.
translation.ja: 希望をくれた

translation.en: Then, in 1985,
we actually were married in the prison.
translation.ja: 僕たちは刑務所内で結婚した

translation.en: She looked real beautiful. She was radiant.
translation.ja: 彼女は美しく輝いてた

translation.en: I couldn't wait to hold her. It was great.
translation.ja: 彼女を抱きしめて 幸せだった

translation.en: This whole thing changed my life, brought me more to religion.
translation.ja: 事件をきっかけに 信仰心が強くなった

translation.en: I am not possessed.
translation.ja: もう悪魔はいない

translation.en: I never had an exorcism,
translation.ja: 除霊はしてないが

translation.en: but I'm not possessed, and I know how to protect myself.
translation.ja: 憑依されてないし 防御する方法も知った

translation.en: I know what prayers to say, so I'm very much in control.
translation.ja: 祈ることで自分を守れるんだ

translation.en: My faith keeps me strong.
translation.ja: 信仰が守ってくれる

translation.en: So everything seems to be fine. Life is moving forward.
translation.ja: それで人生が平和になった

translation.en: I think this whole case affected the entire family.
translation.ja: この事件は家族全員に 影響を与えた

translation.en: It scarred everybody.
translation.ja: 誰もが傷ついた

translation.en: It's twisted all of our lives upside down, and it's difficult to talk about.
translation.ja: 人生がひっくり返った 話すのもつらいほど

translation.en: It's been over 40 years…
translation.ja: 40年以上経ったが…

translation.en: …but it changed us
translation.ja: すべてが変わってしまった

translation.en: and has had long-lasting effects on everyone in the family.
translation.ja: その影響は俺たち家族に 長いこと続いてる

translation.en: We're at the point where we're basically all scattered.
translation.ja: 俺たちは今 バラバラだ

translation.en: You know, none of us really talk no more.
translation.ja: もう互いに話すこともない

translation.en: [David] Seeing the pictures…
translation.ja: 写真を見ると―

translation.en: they make me scared again and very sad, because there's an 11-year-old boy
translation.ja: 恐ろしくなるし悲しい ここにいる11才の少年は まだ平和な人生にいるから

translation.en: having a normal childhood until this happened.
translation.ja: ここにいる11才の少年は まだ平和な人生にいるから

translation.en: I gotta deal with it every day.
translation.ja: いまだに苦しんでる

translation.en: Well, this story, you want to know who's telling the truth.
translation.ja: 誰が真実を語ってるか 知りたいだろ

translation.en: After my parents died, my wife and I were going through their belongings.
translation.ja: 両親の死後 俺と妻で 遺品を整理をした

translation.en: My mother wrote down everything. She had OCD.
translation.ja: 母は強迫性障害だったらしい

translation.en: It'd be on a piece of paper, a calendar, or whatever. She'd write notes down.
translation.ja: 残されたメモや カレンダーに書かれてた

translation.en: On this one note, it said,
translation.ja: あるメモに

translation.en: "Well, the family had their medicine tonight, and everything was good."
translation.ja: “今夜 家族は薬を飲んだ”と

translation.en: As we looked into things,
translation.ja: さらに調べてみると―

translation.en: we realized there's more to this medicine.
translation.ja: この薬には深い意味があった

translation.en: We found out that she was putting Sominex in our food.
translation.ja: 母は食事に ソミネックス(睡眠薬)を入れてた

translation.en: And she's been giving it to the whole family for quite a long time.
translation.ja: それを長期間 家族に食べさせてた

translation.en: [ad narrator] Some people can fall asleep anyplace.
translation.ja: どこでも眠れる人もいれば

translation.en: But did simple tension keep you awake last night?
translation.ja: 緊張で寝られない人も

translation.en: Take Sominex tonight and sleep. Sominex is absolutely not habit-forming.
translation.ja: ソミネックスを飲めば大丈夫 常習性もありません

translation.en: Just take two Sominex tablets as directed for 100% safe sleep and wake up refreshed.
translation.ja: ２錠飲めば安全で快適な 睡眠が得られます

translation.en: I remember my mother serving us dinner. Her bowl was always separate from ours.
translation.ja: 母が夕食の時はいつも 俺たちと違う食器だった

translation.en: So if she had spaghetti, everybody eats out of the bowl.
translation.ja: パスタを大皿から分けても

translation.en: She'd have hers separate. It's like, "Want more?" She goes, "No, I'm good."
translation.ja: 彼女のは別で おかわりもしなかった

translation.en: I believe my mother used Sominex to control all us boys and my dad.
translation.ja: 母は俺たちに睡眠薬を 与えてたんだ 父にもね

translation.en: At the end of the day, if everybody's tired and exhausted,
translation.ja: １日の終わりは みんな疲れてる

translation.en: guess what? Everybody's gonna rest and sit down. There's no more problems.
translation.ja: 寝てしまうだけなら 問題ない

translation.en: But Sominex has long-lasting effects on people.
translation.ja: だが長期服用すれば 副作用が起きる

translation.en: Mood swings, weight gain, and hallucinations.
translation.ja: 気分の浮き沈み 体重増加 幻覚症状も出る

translation.en: [Carl] It is very possible
translation.ja: 可能性はある

translation.en: that my brother David has ingested enough of this stuff over the years,
translation.ja: デヴィッドは睡眠薬の影響で 異常な行動を起こしたんだ

translation.en: where he did see things.
translation.ja: 異常な行動を起こしたんだ

translation.en: [possessed David] I'll kill you.
translation.ja: 殺してやる

translation.en: Jesus is going to die in hell.
translation.ja: イエスは地獄に落ちる

translation.en: [Carl] Or at least he thought he saw things.
translation.ja: 幻覚を見たのかも

translation.en: [possessed David] I'll murder you, you bastard.
translation.ja: 殺してやる クソ野郎

translation.en: [Carl] Between David, Arne, my brother Alan…
translation.ja: デヴィッドとアーニー アランも―

translation.en: They were all victims at the end of the day.
translation.ja: 結局は被害者なんだ

translation.en: My… My mother would not drug the family.
translation.ja: 母は薬を飲ませてない

translation.en: My mom took good care of us.
translation.ja: 彼女は家族を大事にしてた

translation.en: The truth is, when I was 11 years old,
translation.ja: 真実は 俺は11才の時

translation.en: I was possessed by a demonic spirit, I guess you can call it.
translation.ja: 悪魔のようなものに 憑依されたということだ

translation.en: That's what the truth is. I have no reason to lie about anything.
translation.ja: それが真実だ ウソをつく理由はない

translation.en: I guess, like my dad, I go buy a piece of junk and I fix it.
translation.ja: 今は父のように 何かを修理してる

translation.en: Just stay occupied. Just stay busy.
translation.ja: 集中して何も考えないために

translation.en: Because idle hands make the devil's work.
translation.ja: 悪魔は怠け者に 忍び寄るんだ
